private_information: I can only move vowel-labeled blocks. The vowel blocks present are A, E, I.
I can only interact with the top block of any stack and move one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the goal configuration is achieved in cooperation with the other agent.

private_information: I can only move consonant-labeled blocks. The consonant blocks present are J, F, D, N, M, K, H, C, G, L, B.
I can only interact with the top block of any stack and move one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the goal configuration is achieved in cooperation with the other agent.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their local analyses into a single planning problem.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownward planner and ensure agent actions remain distinct.
orchestrator.goal: Create a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global stacking goal while keeping vowel and consonant actions distinct.

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labeled blocks: J, F, D, N, I, E, A, M, K, H, C, G, L, B.
Only the top block of any stack may be moved and only one block can be moved at a time.
One agent may only move vowel blocks and the other agent may only move consonant blocks.
Initially there are two stacks on the table. Stack 1 has base J and from bottom to top is J, N, A, M, K, C. Stack 2 has base F and from bottom to top is F, D, I, E, H, G, L, B.
The global goal is a single stack with bottom N on the table and from bottom to top N, M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A where A is on top of B and N is on the table.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a block-moving agent that can only move vowel-labeled blocks. Provide a clear description of your local capabilities, constraints, and a conservative local plan sketch in natural language describing moves you can perform given only your information. Do not emit PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your objective is: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Describe which top blocks you can legally move, enumerate any local preconditions and effects you observe, and provide a step-by-step natural language plan sketch of the moves you can perform towards the global goal. If information is missing, do not assume unknown facts. Output must be a descriptive analysis and a local plan sketch, not a PDDL domain or problem.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a block-moving agent that can only move consonant-labeled blocks. Provide a clear description of your local capabilities, constraints, and a conservative local plan sketch in natural language describing moves you can perform given only your information. Do not emit PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your objective is: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Describe which top blocks you can legally move, enumerate any local preconditions and effects you observe, and provide a step-by-step natural language plan sketch of the moves you can perform towards the global goal. If information is missing, do not assume unknown facts. Output must be a descriptive analysis and a local plan sketch, not a PDDL domain or problem.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning for FastDownward. Produce a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and a PDDL problem using STRIPS-style constructs where possible. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain keeps vowel-agent actions and consonant-agent actions distinct, model the constraint that only top blocks are movable, and model that vowel_agent can only move vowel blocks and consonant_agent can only move consonant blocks. If the agents provided partial analyses, integrate them and resolve naming mismatches conservatively. The output should be ready for input to FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The public information is: {environment->public_information}. The global goal to achieve is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the analysis from the vowel agent: {vowel_analysis}. Here is the analysis from the consonant agent: {consonant_analysis}. Integrate these analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownward. Keep actions for vowel_agent and consonant_agent distinct by prefixing or grouping their actions. Model stacks using predicates for on, on-table, clear, and agent-specific movability. Do not invent additional blocks. If any information needed for a complete PDDL is missing, state minimal, explicit assumptions in comments within the PDDL problem section before the problem definition, then produce the domain and problem. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
